statements: UPDATE financial_trends SET revenue = 1500 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_trends SET expenses = 800 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE financial_trends SET profit = revenue - expenses WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE financial_trends SET profit = revenue - expenses WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_trends SET profit = revenue - expenses WHERE date >= '2022-01-01' AND date < '2022-04-01';
UPDATE financial_trends SET profit = revenue - expenses WHERE revenue > 100000 AND expenses < 50000;
UPDATE financial_trends SET revenue = 5000 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_trends SET expenses = 2000 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE customer_behavior SET description = 'Updated description' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_trends SET revenue = revenue * 1.1 WHERE date >= '2022-01-01';
UPDATE financial_trends SET expenses = expenses + 500 WHERE date >= '2022-01-01';
UPDATE customer_behavior SET description = 'Updated description' WHERE behavior_type = 'Purchase' AND customer_id = 12345;
UPDATE financial_trends SET trend_category = 'Sales' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE customer_behavior SET purchase_amount = 150.50 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE historical_data SET source = 'New Source' WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE financial_trends SET value = value * 1.1 WHERE value < 1000
UPDATE customer_behavior SET purchase_amount = purchase_amount * 0.9 WHERE product_name = 'Electronics'
UPDATE historical_data SET data_description = CONCAT(data_description, ' - Updated') WHERE id = 1
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 1000 WHERE date = '2022-10-15';
UPDATE customer_data SET loyalty_points = loyalty_points + 20 WHERE customer_id = 1234;
UPDATE historical_trends SET trend_value = trend_value * 1.1 WHERE trend_type = 'sales';
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = revenue + 1000, expenses = expenses - 500 WHERE date = '2022-05-15';
UPDATE customer_data SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE customer_id = 12345;
UPDATE historical_trends SET trend_value = trend_value * 1.05 WHERE trend_type = 'Sales';
UPDATE financial_trends SET trend_value = 100 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE customer_behavior SET behavior_score = 8.5 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE historical_data SET data_value = 75.2 WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE financial_trends SET trend_value = trend_value * 1.1 WHERE trend_name = 'Sales';
UPDATE customer_behavior SET behavior_score = CASE behavior_type WHEN 'Purchase' THEN behavior_score + 10 WHEN 'Engagement' THEN behavior_score - 5 ELSE behavior_score END;
UPDATE historical_data SET data_value = data_value * 0.9 WHERE data_type = 'Stock Price';
